Nebulized arformoterol in patients with COPD : a 12 - week , multicenter , randomized , double - blind , double - dummy , placebo - and active - controlled trial .
【GOLD_E】
arformoterol	chem
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to assess the efficacy and tolerability of nebulized arformoterol tartrate ( a selective , long - acting beta ( 2 ) - adrenergic agonist that is the [ R , R ] isomer of formoterol ) and salmeterol xinafoate versus placebo in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) .
【GOLD_E】
beta(2)-adrenergic	geneY
[R,R]isomerofformoterol	chem
salmeterolxinafoate	chem
arformoteroltartrate	chem
【PRE_E】
arformoteroltartrate	chem
beta(2)-adrenergic	geneN
[R,R]isomerofformoterol	chem
salmeterolxinafoate	chem
【GOLD_R】
[R,R]isomerofformoterol	beta(2)-adrenergic	C5
arformoteroltartrate	beta(2)-adrenergic	C5
【PRE_R】

METHODS : This 12 - week , multicenter , randomized , double - blind , double - dummy , placebo - and active - controlled trial was conducted at 60 centers across the United States .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Male and female patients aged > or = 35 years with physician - diagnosed COPD received arformoterol ( 15 microg BID , 25 microg BID , or 50 microg QD via nebulizer ) , salmeterol ( 42 microg BID via metered dose inhaler ) , or placebo .
【GOLD_E】
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
nebulizer	chem
salmeterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Pulmonary function was assessed by spirometry ; dyspnea , by the Transitional Dyspnea Index ( TDI ) ; and health status , by the St .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
TDI	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

George 's Respiratory Questionnaire ( SGRQ ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Adverse events ( AEs ) were assessed by site personnel at all clinic visits ( screening , first dose at week 0 , and at weeks 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 , and follow - up ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

COPD exacerbations were defined as worsening respiratory status requiring a change in medication or an unscheduled provider visit .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

RESULTS : A total of 717 patients received study medication .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The demographic composition of all treatment arms was similar .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The mean age was 62.9 years , 58 % were men , and mean baseline forced expiratory volume in 1 second ( FEV ( 1 ) ) was 1.2 L ( 41 % predicted ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Mean improvement in trough FEV ( 1 ) over 12 weeks was significantly greater with all 3 arformoterol doses ( 15 microg BID , + 16.9 % ; 25 microg BID , + 18.9 % ; 50 microg QD , + 14.9 % ) and for salmeterol ( + 17.4 % ) relative to placebo ( + 6.0 % ; P < 0.001 ) .
【GOLD_E】
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

There were significantly greater improvements in the mean percentage change in FEV ( 1 ) AUC ( 0 - 12h ) from the predose value over 12 weeks ( 15 microg BID , 12.7 % , 25 microg BID , 13.9 % , 50 microg QD , 18.9 % ; salmeterol , 9.8 % ) versus placebo ( 2.7 % ; P < or = 0.001 ) ; all doses of arformoterol were statistically different from salmeterol for this end point ( P < or = 0.024 ) .
【GOLD_E】
salmeterol	chem
【PRE_E】
salmeterol	chem
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

At week 12 , TDI focal scores were significantly greater with all arformoterol doses compared with placebo ( mean [ 95 % CI ] : 15 microg BID , 0.97 [ 0.25 - 1.69 ] ; 25 microg BID , 1.08 [ 0.3 - 1.86 ] ; 50 microg QD , 1.04 [ 0.32 - 1.771 ) , suggesting treatment - associated improvement in dyspnea , however , the difference between salmeterol and placebo was not statistically significant ( 0.36 [ - 0.40 to 1.12 ] ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
TDI	chem
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Improvements in health status , as measured using SGRQ total scores , were - 2.6 to - 3.6 U in the arformoterol groups , - 4.4 U for salmeterol , and - 1.2 U for placebo ; 95 % CI of differences versus placebo suggested significant improvement for the arformoterol 25 microg BID and salmeterol groups .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
arformoterol	chem
salmeterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

There was a similar frequency of AEs and COPD exacerbations across all groups , including placebo .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CONCLUSIONS : In this trial , patients with moderate to severe COPD administered nebulized arformoterol over 12 weeks were observed to have significant and sustained improvements in airway function and dyspnea compared with placebo .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The results also suggest that all doses of arformoterol , including the lowest dose ( 15 microg BID ) , were effective .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Overall , nebulized arformoterol was well tolerated .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
arformoterol	chem
【GOLD_R】

Distinct patterns of mutations occurring in de novo AML versus AML arising in the setting of severe congenital neutropenia .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
AML	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Severe congenital neutropenia ( SCN ) is an inborn disorder of granulopoiesis .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Like most other bone marrow failure syndromes , it is associated with a marked propensity to transform into a myelodysplastic syndrome ( MDS ) or acute leukemia , with a cumulative rate of transformation to MDS / leukemia that exceeds 20 % .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The genetic ( and / or epigenetic ) changes that contribute to malignant transformation in SCN are largely unknown .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
SCN	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In this study , we performed mutational profiling of 14 genes previously implicated in leukemogenesis using 14 MDS / leukemia samples from patients with SCN .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
SCN	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We used high - throughput exon - based resequencing of whole - genome - amplified genomic DNA with a semiautomated method to detect mutations .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The sensitivity and specificity of the sequencing pipeline was validated by determining the frequency of mutations in these 14 genes using 188 de novo AML samples .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

As expected , mutations of tyrosine kinase genes ( FLT3 , KIT , and JAK2 ) were common in de novo AML , with a cumulative frequency of 30 % .
【GOLD_E】
JAK2	geneY
tyrosine	chem
tyrosinekinase	geneN
FLT3	geneY
KIT	geneY
【PRE_E】
tyrosinekinase	geneN
FLT3	geneY
KIT	geneY
JAK2	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In contrast , no mutations in these genes were detected in the SCN samples ; instead , mutations of CSF3R , encoding the G - CSF receptor , were common .
【GOLD_E】
CSF3R	geneY
G-CSFreceptor	geneY
【PRE_E】
SCN	geneN
CSF3R	geneY
G-CSFreceptor	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These data support the hypothesis that mutations of CSF3R may provide the `` activated tyrosine kinase signal `` that is thought to be important for leukemogenesis .

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

As GABAergic synapses in the PVN impinge directly on oxytocinergic neurons or on excitatory glutamatergic synapses , which also impinge on oxytocinergic neurons , these results suggest that the blockade of CB1 receptors decreases GABA release in the PVN , increasing in turn glutamatergic neurotransmission to activate oxytocinergic neurons mediating penile erection .

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】

BACKGROUND : The efficacy of oral anticoagulant therapy is largely conditioned by both environmental and genetic factors .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

OBJECTIVES : To attempt to define the genetic profile involved in the response to this treatment .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

PATIENTS AND METHODS : We selected 100 men younger than 75 years , with non - valvular atrial fibrillation , who started anticoagulation with acenocoumarol following the same protocol : 3 mg for three consecutive days .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
acenocoumarol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Then , doses were individually adjusted to achieve a steady International Normalized Ratio ( INR ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Carriers of both variants ( 27 % of the sample ) achieved the highest INR [ 2.26 ( 1.70 - 3.32 ) ] and required the lowest dose ( 14.1 + / - 5.1 mg week ( - 1 ) ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

This genetic profile was particularly relevant in patients with INR > or = 3.5 at the start of therapy ( P = 0.005 ; odds ratio = 6.67 , 95 % confidence interval = 1.32 - 37.43 ) .

【PRE_R】

CONCLUSIONS : Our results suggest that CALU a29809g might be a new genetic factor involved in the pharmacogenetics of anticoagulant therapy , and confirm that specific genetic profiles defined by different polymorphisms will determine the initial response and dose required to achieve a stable and safe INR .

The active site coordination of CDO comprises a mononuclear iron ligated by the Nepsilon atoms of three protein - derived histidines , thus representing a new variant on the 2 - histidine - 1 - carboxylate ( 2H1C ) facial triad motif .

Typically , addition of NO to a mononuclear non - heme iron center results in the formation of an { FeNO } 7 ( S = 3 / 2 ) species characterized by an axial EPR spectrum with gx , gy , and gz values of approximately 4 , approximately 4 , and approximately 2 , respectively .

OPINION STATEMENT : Treatment of early stage breast cancer requires a multimodality approach in order to eradicate residual cancer and prevent recurrent disease .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Targeting the pathways that promote or sustain cancer cell growth and invasion is critical to the effective treatment of breast and other cancers .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Overexpression of the family of HER receptors have been associated with a variety of malignancies ; the first and best studied is the association of overexpression of the HER2 / neu receptor with a more aggressive breast cancer phenotype and poorer survival .

【GOLD_R】

Recent clinical studies form the basis for new guidelines for the treatment of advanced RCC : sorafenib should be used as a second - line treatment , sunitinib as the first - line therapy for good and intermediate - risk patients , and temsirolimus should be considered as first - line treatment for poor - risk patients .

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In addition , it is important to define the mechanisms of resistance on their use and to further investigate biomarkers and enhance treatment efficacy for the individual patients .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The development of these targeted therapies represents an exciting step forward in the treatment of advanced RCC .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Management of psoriasis : the position of retinoid drugs .
【GOLD_E】
retinoid	chem
【PRE_E】
retinoid	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Oral synthetic retinoids have been established as effective systemic therapy for psoriasis since their introduction for clinical use in the 1970s ; a compound for topical use , tazarotene has been recently marketed .
【GOLD_E】
retinoids	chem
tazarotene	chem
【PRE_E】
tazarotene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Despite the demonstrated clinical success of retinoid therapy in psoriasis , its mechanism of action has not been fully elucidated , and investigators are confronted with two paradoxes .
【GOLD_E】
retinoid	chem
【PRE_E】
retinoid	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

One is that the binding of retinoids to nuclear retinoic acid receptors ( RARs ) does not match their therapeutic efficacy : acitretin activates the three receptor subtypes , RAR - alpha , - beta and - gamma , without measurable receptor binding , whereas tazarotene preferentially binds to and activates RAR - beta and - gamma in preference to RAR - alpha .
【GOLD_E】
retinoicacidreceptors	geneN
RARs	geneN
RAR-alpha,-betaand-gamma	geneN
RAR-betaand-gamma	geneN
RAR-alpha	geneY
retinoids	chem
retinoicacid	chem
acitretin	chem
tazarotene	chem
【PRE_E】
nuclearretinoicacidreceptors	geneN
RARs	geneN

RAR-alpha,-betaand-gamma	geneN
measurablereceptor	geneN
tazarotene	chem
RAR-betaand-gamma	geneN
RAR-alpha	geneY
【GOLD_R】
tazarotene	RAR-alpha	C3
【PRE_R】

The other is that there is already increased formation of retinoic acid in the psoriatic lesion .
【GOLD_E】
retinoicacid	chem
【PRE_E】
retinoicacid	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Answering these questions should result in better use of these drugs in the treatment of psoriasis .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Oral administration of acitretin remains one of the first therapeutic choices for severe psoriasis , particularly in association with ultraviolet light therapy , of which it may decrease the carcinogenic risk .
【GOLD_E】
acitretin	chem
【PRE_E】
acitretin	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Topical tazarotene is suitable for moderate plaque psoriasis .
【GOLD_E】
tazarotene	chem
【PRE_E】
tazarotene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Its efficacy and tolerability can be enhanced by the addition of topical corticosteroids ; its irritative potential is counterbalanced by a sustained therapeutic effect after the treatment is stopped .
【GOLD_E】
corticosteroids	chem
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】

Rasagiline [ N - propargyl - l ( R ) - aminoindan ] is a second - generation propargylamine pharmacophore that selectively and irreversibly inhibits brain MAO - B and is specifically designed for the treatment of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

RESULTS : Data from 63 clinical and laboratory studies were analyzed .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Based on the results from those studies , we concluded that rasagiline PO QD , at the therapeutic dosage range of 0.5 to 1 rag / d , is effective and well tolerated and completely , selectively , and specifically inhibited MAO - B .
【GOLD_E】

PO	MAO-B	C4

Pharmacologically , rasagiline was found to be < or = 10 - fold more potent than selegiline and was not metabolized to amphetamine derivatives .
【GOLD_E】
rasagiline	chem
selegiline	chem
amphetamine	chem
【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Rasagiline was effective both as monotherapy in early PD and as adjunctive treatment in patients with advancing PD and motor fluctuations .
【GOLD_E】
Rasagiline	chem
【PRE_E】
Rasagiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

As monotherapy , rasagiline provided modest yet clinically meaningful benefit .
【GOLD_E】
rasagiline	chem
【PRE_E】
rasagiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

A randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled study found that , after 26 weeks of treatment , the adjusted effect size for total Unified Parkinson 's Disease Rating Scale score was - 4.20 ( 95 % CI , - 5.66 to - 2.73 ) for rasagiline 1 mg / d versus placebo ( P < 0.001 ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
rasagiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Preliminary long - term data from an open - label study suggest a sustained therapeutic advantage when rasagiline is initiated early ( before the need for dopaminergic agents ) rather than later .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
rasagiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In patients with more advanced disease who received treatment with dopaminergic agents , rasagiline and entacapone were associated with reductions of `` off `` time significantly greater than placebo ( - 1.18 and - 1.2 vs 0.4 hour ; both , P < or = 0.001 ) .
【GOLD_E】
rasagiline	chem
entacapone	chem
【PRE_E】
rasagiline	chem
entacapone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Rasagiline was well tolerated in younger ( aged < ; 70 years ) and older ( aged > or = 70 years ) patients with early or advanced PD .
【GOLD_E】
Rasagiline	chem
【PRE_E】
Rasagiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】
tyramine	chem
【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】
tyramine	chem
tyramine	chem
【PRE_E】
tyramine	chem
tyramine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In experimental models , rasagiline has been found to have neuroprotective properties that may be independent of MAO - B inhibition .
【GOLD_E】

CONCLUSIONS : Based on this review , rasagiline has been found to be well tolerated and effective in the treatment of early PD and as adjunctive treatment in motor fluctuations .

Top1p clamps around duplex DNA , wherein the core and C - terminal domains are connected by extended alpha - helices ( linker domain ) , which position the active site Tyr of the C - terminal domain within the catalytic pocket .

Type 2 diabetes and oral antihyperglycemic drugs .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Type II diabetes is a heterogeneous disease where environment and genetics are important factors for the expression of the disease .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The high cost for treating complications of diabetes is a burden for public health systems and governments worldwide .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Type II diabetes has been causing debilitation worldwide for many decades , and a single drug that safely treats the disease has yet to be discovered .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Sulfonylureas , biguanides , alpha - glucosidase , meglitinides , DPP - 4 inhibitors and thiazolidinediones are among the classes of oral hypoglycemic drugs available to treat Type II diabetes , but concerns exist regarding safety and efficacy of these drugs .
【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Triple pharmacological blockade of the renin - angiotensin - aldosterone system in nondiabetic CKD : an open - label crossover randomized controlled trial .

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

BACKGROUND : Agents inhibiting the renin - angiotensin - aldosterone ( RAAS ) system have an important role in slowing the progression of chronic kidney disease .
【GOLD_E】
renin	geneY
angiotensin	geneY
aldosterone	chem
【PRE_E】
renin	geneY
angiotensin	geneY
aldosterone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We evaluated the hypothesis that the addition of an aldosterone receptor antagonist to an angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor and angiotensin II type 1 ( AT - 1 ) receptor blocker ( ARB ) ( triple RAAS blockade ) may provide an additional benefit compared with an ACE inhibitor and ARB ( double RAAS blockade ) .
【GOLD_E】
aldosteronereceptor	geneY
angiotensin-convertingenzyme	geneY
ACE	geneY
angiotensinIItype1(AT-1)receptor	geneY
ACE	geneY
aldosterone	chem
angiotensinII	chem
【PRE_E】
aldosteronereceptor	geneN
angiotensin-convertingenzyme	geneY
ACE	geneY
angiotensinIItype1(AT-1)receptor	geneY
ACE	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

DESIGN : Randomized open controlled crossover study .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

SETTING & PARTICIPANTS : 18 whites ( 7 women , 11 men ) from the Outpatient Department of Nephrology with chronic nondiabetic proteinuric kidney diseases , mean age 42.4 + / - 1.9 years ( SEM ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

INTERVENTIONS : In the 8 - week run - in period , all participants received the ACE inhibitor cilazapril ( 5 mg ) , the ARB telmisartan ( 80 mg ) , and the diuretic hydrochlorothiazide ( 12.5 mg ) as double RAAS blockade to achieve the target blood pressure of less than 130 / 80 mm Hg .
【GOLD_E】
ACE	geneY
cilazapril	chem
telmisarta	chem
hydrochlorothiazide	chem
【PRE_E】
ACE	geneY

telmisartan	chem
hydrochlorothiazide	chem
【GOLD_R】

【PRE_R】
ACE	cilazapril	C4
ACE	telmisartan	C4
ACE	hydrochlorothiazide	C4

Participants were then randomly assigned to 2 treatment sequences , either the addition of spironolactone ( 25 mg ) ( triple RAAS blockade ) through 8 weeks followed by double RAAS blockade through 8 weeks ( sequence 1 ) or double RAAS blockade followed by triple RAAS blockade ( sequence 2 ) .
【GOLD_E】
spironolactone	chem
【PRE_E】
spironolactone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES : 24 - hour urine protein excretion ( primary end point ) and markers of tubular injury and fibrosis ( secondary end points ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Analysis was performed using analysis of variance for repeated measurements .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

RESULTS : At baseline , mean serum creatinine level was 1.16 + / - 0.09 mg / dL ( 103 + / - 8 micromol / L ) , estimated glomerular filtration rate was 107.8 mL / min ( 95 % confidence interval , 93 to 140.9 [ 1.8 mL / s ; 95 % confidence interval , 1.55 to 2.35 ; Cockcroft - Gault formula ) , and 24 - hour mean proteinuria was 0.97 + / - 0.18 g .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
creatinine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Mean urine protein excretion was 0.7 g / 24 h ( 95 % confidence interval , 0.48 to 0.92 ) less after triple RAAS blockade than after double RAAS blockade ( P = 0.01 ) , without change in blood pressure .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Urine excretion of N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase ( P = 0.02 ) and amino - terminal propeptide of type III procollagen ( P = 0.05 ) also significantly decreased .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

However , no patient was withdrawn because of adverse effects .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

LIMITATIONS : Absence of blinding , small sample size , short treatment period , absence of histological assessment .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CONCLUSIONS : Administration of an aldosterone receptor antagonist in addition to double RAAS blockade with an ACE inhibitor and ARB may slow the progression of chronic kidney disease .

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : Voltage - operated sodium channels constitute major target sites for local anaesthetic - like action .
【GOLD_E】

sodium	chem
【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The clinical use of local anaesthetics is still limited by severe side effects , in particular , arrhythmias and convulsions .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These side effects render the search for new local anaesthetics a matter of high interest .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

EXPERIMENTAL APPROACH : We have investigated the effects of three halogenated structural analogues of propofol on voltage - operated human skeletal muscle sodium channels ( Na ( V ) 1.4 ) and the effect of one compound ( 4 - chloropropofol ) on neuronal sodium channels ( Na ( V ) 1.2 ) heterologously expressed in human embryonic kidney cell line 293 .
【GOLD_E】

KEY RESULTS : 4 - Iodo - , 4 - bromo - and 4 - chloropropofol reversibly suppressed depolarization - induced whole - cell sodium inward currents with high potency .

【PRE_R】

Recovery from fast inactivation was prolonged in the presence of drug leading to an accumulation of block during repetitive stimulation at high frequencies ( 100 Hz ) .
【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_R】

CONCLUSIONS AND IMPLICATIONS : Halogenated propofol analogues constitute a novel class of sodium channel - blocking drugs possessing almost 100 - fold higher potency compared with the local anaesthetic and anti - arrhythmic drug lidocaine .

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【PRE_E】
irbesartan	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

DNA damage is accepted as a consequence of thymidylate deprivation induced by chemotherapeutic inhibitors of thymidylate synthase ( TS ) , but the types of damage and signaling responses remain incompletely understood .
【GOLD_E】

Thymidylate deprivation increases dUTP and uracil in DNA , which is removed by base excision repair ( BER ) .
【GOLD_E】

uracil	chem
【PRE_E】
Thymidylate	chem

uracil	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Because BER requires a synthesis step , strand break intermediates presumably accumulate .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
BER	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Thymidylate deprivation also induces cell cycle arrest during replication .
【GOLD_E】
Thymidylate	chem
【PRE_E】
Thymidylate	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Homologous recombination ( HR ) is a means of repairing persistent BER intermediates and collapsed replication forks .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
BER	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

There are also intimate links between HR and S - phase checkpoint pathways .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In this study , the goals were to determine the involvement of HR - associated proteins and DNA damage signaling responses to thymidylate deprivation .

thymidylate	chem
【PRE_E】
thymidylate	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

FSA	dehydrogenase	C4
FSA	isomerase	C4

FSA is a cofactor site - directed reagent that binds with similar affinity as a competitive inhibitor of NAD + reduction by dehydrogenase ( Ki = 162 microM ) or as a stimulator of isomerase ( Km = 153 microM ) .
【GOLD_E】
dehydrogenase	geneN
NAD+	chem
【PRE_E】
NAD+	chem
dehydrogenase	geneN
isomerase	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
NAD+	dehydrogenase	C4
NAD+	isomerase	C4

Parallel plots derived from Kitz and Wilson analysis indicate that FSA inactivates the two enzyme activities with equal alkylation efficiency ( k3 / Ki = 1 / slope = 0.51 / mol - s for both ) .
【GOLD_E】
FSA	chem
【PRE_E】
FSA	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The 3 beta - hydroxysteroid substrate , pregnenolone , protects isomerase as well as dehydrogenase from inactivation by FSA .
【GOLD_E】
dehydrogenase	geneN
3beta-hydroxysteroid	chem
pregnenolone	chem
FSA	chem
【PRE_E】
3beta-hydroxysteroid	chem
pregnenolone	chem
protectsisomerase	geneN
dehydrogenase	geneN
【GOLD_R】
FSA	dehydrogenase	C4
【PRE_R】
3beta-hydroxysteroid	dehydrogenase	C9
pregnenolone	dehydrogenase	C9

These observations are evidence for a single cofactor binding region which services both enzyme activities .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Tyrosine kinase blockers : new hope for successful cancer therapy .
【GOLD_E】
Tyrosine	chem
Tyrosinekinase	geneN
【PRE_E】
Tyrosinekinase	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Tyrosine kinases ( TKs ) are attractive targets for cancer therapy , as quite often their abnormal signaling has been linked with tumor development and growth .
【GOLD_E】
Tyrosine	chem
Tyrosinekinases	geneN
TKs	geneN
【PRE_E】
Tyrosinekinases	geneN
TKs	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Constitutive activated TKs stimulate multiple signaling pathways responsible for DNA repair , apoptosis , and cell proliferation .
【GOLD_E】
TKs	geneN
【PRE_E】
Constitutive	geneN
TKs	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

During the last few years , thorough analysis of the mechanism underlying tyrosine kinase 's activity led to novel cancer therapy using TKs blockers .
【GOLD_E】
tyrosine	chem
tyrosinekinase	geneN
TKs	geneN
【PRE_E】
tyrosinekinase	geneN
TKs	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These drugs are remarkably effective in the treatment of various human tumors including head and neck , gastric , prostate and breast cancer and leukemias .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The most successful example of kinase blockers is Imatinib ( Imatinib mesylate , Gleevec , STI571 ) , the inhibitor of Bcr / Abl oncoprotein , which has become a first - line therapy for chronic myelogenous leukemia .

Transdermal selegiline for the treatment of major depressive disorder .
【GOLD_E】
selegiline	chem
【PRE_E】
selegiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Non - selective inhibition of monoamine oxidase ( MAO ) enzymes ( ie , isoforms A and B ) in the brain are associated with clinically significant antidepressant effects .
【GOLD_E】
monoamineoxidase	geneN
MAO	geneN
monoamine	chem
【PRE_E】
monoamineoxidase	geneN
MAO	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In the US , the selegiline transdermal system ( STS ; EMSAM ) is the first antidepressant transdermal delivery system to receive Food and Drug Administration ( FDA ) approved labeling for the treatment of major depressive disorder ( MDD ) .
【GOLD_E】
selegiline	chem
【PRE_E】
selegiline	chem
EMSAM	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Currently , the use of orally administered MAO inhibitor antidepressants ( eg , phenelzine , tranylcypromine ) is limited by the risk of tyramine - provoked events ( eg , acute hypertension and headache , also known as the `` cheese reaction `` ) when combined with dietary tyramine .
【GOLD_E】
MAO	geneN
phenelzine	chem
tranylcypromine	chem
tyramine	chem
rytyrami	chem
【PRE_E】
MAO	geneN
phenelzine	chem
tranylcypromine	chem
tyramine	chem
tyramine	chem
【GOLD_R】
phenelzine	MAO	C4
tranylcypromine	MAO	C4
【PRE_R】
MAO	phenelzine	C4
MAO	tranylcypromine	C4

The selegiline transdermal system is the only MAOI available in the US for the treatment of MDD that does not require dietary restriction at the clinically effective dose of 6 mg / 24 hours .
【GOLD_E】
selegiline	chem
【PRE_E】
selegiline	chem
MAOI	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Delivery of selegiline transdermally ( EMSAM ( ( R ) ) ) bypasses hepatic first pass metabolism , thereby avoiding significant inhibition of gastrointestinal and hepatic MAO - A activity ( ie , reduced risk of tyramine - provoked events ) while still providing sufficient levels of selegiline in the brain to produce an antidepressant effect .
【GOLD_E】
MAO-A	geneY
tyramine	chem
selegiline	chem
【PRE_E】
selegilinetransdermally	chem
EMSAM((R)	chem
MAO-A	geneY
tyramine	chem
selegiline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
selegilinetransdermally	MAO-A	C4
EMSAM((R)	MAO-A	C4
MAO-A	selegiline	C4

At dosages of 6 - 12 mg / 24 hours , EMSAM has been shown to improve symptoms of depression , have good tolerability , and have high rates of medication adherence .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

However , at higher doses of EMSAM ( ie , 9 mg / 24 hours or more ) , dietary restriction of tyramine intake is recommended .
【GOLD_E】
tyramine	chem
【PRE_E】
EMSAM	chem
tyramine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The introduction of EMSAM overcomes many of the safety concerns affiliated with the conventional oral MAO inhibitors and EMSAM may be considered another strategy for the treatment of MDD , especially in patients who can not tolerate oral antidepressants , are poorly adherent , who present with atypical depressive symptoms , or have failed other antidepressants .
【GOLD_E】
MAO	geneN
【PRE_E】
EMSAM	chem
MAO	geneN
EMSAM	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
EMSAM	MAO	C4
MAO	EMSAM	C4

Atomoxetine : a review of its use in attention - deficit hyperactivity disorder in children and adolescents .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine ( Strattera ( R ) ) is a selective norepinephrine ( noradrenaline ) reuptake inhibitor that is not classified as a stimulant , and is indicated for use in patients with attention - deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrine	chem
noradrenaline	chem
Strattera	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
Strattera(R)	chem
norepinephrine	chem
noradrenaline	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine is effective and generally well tolerated .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

It is significantly more effective than placebo and standard current therapy and does not differ significantly from or is noninferior to immediate - release methylphenidate ; however , it is significantly less effective than the extended - release methylphenidate formulation OROS ( R ) methylphenidate ( hereafter referred to as osmotically released methylphenidate ) and extended - release mixed amfetamine salts .
【GOLD_E】
methylphenidate	chem
methylphenidate	chem
methylphenidate	chem
methylphenidate	chem
amfetamine	chem
【PRE_E】
methylphenidate	chem
methylphenidate	chem
OROS(R)methylphenidate	chem
methylphenidate	chem
amfetaminesalts	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine can be administered either as a single daily dose or split into two evenly divided doses , has a negligible risk of abuse or misuse , and is not a controlled substance in the US .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine is particularly useful for patients at risk of substance abuse , as well as those who have co - morbid anxiety or tics , or who do not wish to take a controlled substance .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Thus , atomoxetine is a useful option in the treatment of ADHD in children and adolescents .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The mechanism of action of atomoxetine is unclear , but is thought to be related to its selective inhibition of presynaptic norepinephrine reuptake in the prefrontal cortex .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine has a high affinity and selectivity for norepinephrine transporters , but little or no affinity for various neurotransmitter receptors .
【GOLD_E】
norepinephrinetransporters	geneY
Atomoxetine	chem
neurotransmitterreceptors	geneN
norepinephrine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrinetransporters	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine has a demonstrated ability to selectively inhibit norepinephrine uptake in humans and animals , and studies have shown that it preferentially binds to areas of known high distribution of noradrenergic neurons , such as the fronto - cortical subsystem .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
norepinephrine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine was generally associated with statistically , but not clinically , significant increases in both heart rate and blood pressure in pediatric patients with ADHD .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

While there was an initial loss in expected height and weight among atomoxetine recipients , this eventually returned to normal in the longer term .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Data suggest that atomoxetine is unlikely to have any abuse potential .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine appeared less likely than methylphenidate to exacerbate disordered sleep in pediatric patients with ADHD .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine is rapidly absorbed , and demonstrates dose - proportional increases in plasma exposure .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

It undergoes extensive biotransformation , which is affected by poor metabolism by cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) 2D6 in a small percentage of the population ; these patients have greater exposure to and slower elimination of atomoxetine than extensive metabolizers .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
cytochromeP450(CYP)2D6	geneY
【PRE_E】
cytochromeP450(CYP)2D6	geneY
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
atomoxetine	cytochromeP450(CYP)2D6	C9
【PRE_R】

Patients with hepatic insufficiency show an increase in atomoxetine exposure .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CYP2D6 inhibitors , such as paroxetine , are associated with changes in atomoxetine pharmacokinetics similar to those observed among poor CYP2D6 metabolizers .
【GOLD_E】
paroxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
CYP2D6	geneY
CYP2D6	geneY
【PRE_E】
CYP2D6	geneY

atomoxetine	CYP2D6	C9
【PRE_R】

Once - or twice - daily atomoxetine was effective in the short - term treatment of ADHD in children and adolescents , as observed in several well designed placebo - controlled trials .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine also demonstrated efficacy in the longer term treatment of these patients .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

A single morning dose was shown to be effective into the evening , and discontinuation of atomoxetine was not associated with symptom rebound .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine efficacy did not appear to differ between children and adolescents .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Stimulant - naive patients also responded well to atomoxetine treatment .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine did not differ significantly from or was noninferior to immediate - release methylphenidate in children and adolescents with ADHD with regard to efficacy , and was significantly more effective than standard current therapy ( any combination of medicines [ excluding atomoxetine ] and / or behavioral counseling , or no treatment ) .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

However , atomoxetine was significantly less effective than osmotically released methylphenidate and extended - release mixed amfetamine salts .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
amfetamine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
amfetaminesalts	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The efficacy of atomoxetine did not appear to be affected by the presence of co - morbid disorders , and symptoms of the co - morbid disorders were not affected or were improved by atomoxetine administration .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Health - related quality of life ( HR - QOL ) appeared to be positively affected by atomoxetine in both short - and long - term studies ; atomoxetine also improved HR - QOL to a greater extent than standard current therapy .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine was generally well tolerated in children and adolescents with ADHD .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Common adverse events included headache , abdominal pain , decreased appetite , vomiting , somnolence , and nausea .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The majority of adverse events were mild or moderate ; there was a very low incidence of serious adverse events .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Few patients discontinued atomoxetine treatment because of adverse events .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine discontinuation appeared to be well tolerated , with a low incidence of discontinuation - emergent adverse events .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Atomoxetine appeared better tolerated among extensive CYP2D6 metabolizers than among poor metabolizers .
【GOLD_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
CYP2D6	geneY
【PRE_E】
Atomoxetine	chem
CYP2D6	geneY
【GOLD_R】
Atomoxetine	CYP2D6	C9
【PRE_R】

Slight differences were evident in the adverse event profiles of atomoxetine and stimulants , both immediate - and extended - release .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Somnolence appeared more common among atomoxetine recipients and insomnia appeared more common among stimulant recipients .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

A black - box warning for suicidal ideation has been published in the US prescribing information , based on findings from a meta - analysis showing that atomoxetine is associated with a significantly higher incidence of suicidal ideation than placebo .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Rarely , atomoxetine may also be associated with serious liver injury ; postmarketing data show that three patients have had liver - related adverse events deemed probably related to atomoxetine treatment .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
atomoxetine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Treatment algorithms involving the initial use of atomoxetine appear cost effective versus algorithms involving initial methylphenidate ( immediate - or extended - release ) , dexamfetamine , tricyclic antidepressants , or no treatment in stimulant - naive , - failed , and - contraindicated children and adolescents with ADHD .
【GOLD_E】
atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
dexamfetamine	chem
tricyclic	chem
【PRE_E】
atomoxetine	chem
methylphenidate	chem
dexamfetamine	chem
tricyclic	chem

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

gallamine	chem

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Because these speeds are significantly faster than the responses to antagonists , these data indicate that gallamine and dimethyl - W84 are allosteric ligands and actively induce a conformation of the M ( 2 ) receptor with a reduced affinity for its agonists .

【PRE_R】

Half a century ago , thalidomide was widely prescribed to pregnant women as a sedative but was found to be teratogenic , causing multiple birth defects .
【GOLD_E】
thalidomide	chem
【PRE_E】
thalidomide	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Today , thalidomide is still used in the treatment of leprosy and multiple myeloma , although how it causes limb malformation and other developmental defects is unknown .

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_E】
alcohol	chem
【PRE_E】
alcohol	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Alcohol has been consistently associated with aggression and violence , thus we hoped to expand current understanding of alcohol 's role in aggressive behavior via manipulation of the serotonin ( 5 - HT ) system .

【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Aggression was measured using the point - subtraction aggression paradigm ( PSAP ) , a laboratory model widely used in human aggression studies .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Subjects were administered 5 - mg zolmitriptan and placebo capsules along with alcohol doses of 0.0 , 0.4 and 0.8 g / kg in a within - subject , counterbalanced dosing design .

【PRE_R】

【PRE_E】
alcohol	chem

【PRE_E】
telmisartan	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Blockade of the renin - angiotensin system is an important approach in managing high blood pressure , and has increasingly been shown to affect cardiovascular disease processes mediated by angiotensin II throughout the cardiovascular and renal continua .
【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Telmisartan is an angiotensin II receptor blocker ( ARB ) displaying unique pharmacologic properties , including a longer half life than any other ARB , that result in large and sustained reductions of blood pressure .

【PRE_R】

In patients with mild - to - moderate hypertension , telmisartan has proved superior to other antihypertensive agents ( valsartan , losartan , ramipril , perindopril , and atenolol ) in controlling blood pressure particularly towards the end of the dosing interval .
【GOLD_E】

There is also clinical evidence that telmisartan reduces left ventricular hypertrophy , reduces arterial stiffness and the recurrence of atrial fibrillation , and confers renoprotection .
【GOLD_E】
telmisartan	chem
【PRE_E】
telmisartan	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The ONgoing Telmisartan Alone and in combination with Ramipril Global Endpoint Trial ( ONTARGET ) study has demonstrated that telmisartan has similar cardiovascular protective effects to ramipril in a large , high - risk patient population but was better tolerated .
【GOLD_E】

The powerful and sustained blood pressure control apparent in clinical trials , together with cardiovascular protection and tolerability demonstrated in ONTARGET means that telmisartan may be a preferred option for patients with hypertension .

The selectivity of beta - adrenoceptor agonists at human beta1 - , beta2 - and beta3 - adrenoceptors .
【GOLD_E】
beta-adrenoceptor	geneN
humanbeta1-,beta2-andbeta3-adrenoceptors	geneN
【PRE_E】
beta-adrenoceptor	geneY
humanbeta1-,beta2-andbeta3-adrenoceptors	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : There are two important properties of receptor - ligand interactions : affinity ( the ability of the ligand to bind to the receptor ) and efficacy ( the ability of the receptor - ligand complex to induce a response ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Ligands are classified as agonists or antagonists depending on whether or not they have efficacy .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In theory , it is possible to develop selective agonists based on selective affinity , selective intrinsic efficacy or both .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

This study examined the affinity and intrinsic efficacy of 31 beta - adrenoceptor agonists at the three human beta - adrenoceptors to determine whether the current agonists are subtype selective because of affinity or intrinsic efficacy .
【GOLD_E】
beta-adrenoceptor	geneN
humanbeta-adrenoceptors	geneN
【PRE_E】
beta-adrenoceptor	geneN
humanbeta-adrenoceptors	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

EXPERIMENTAL APPROACH : Stable clonal CHO - K1 cell lines , transfected with either the human beta ( 1 ) , beta ( 2 ) or beta ( 3 ) - adrenoceptor , were used , and whole - cell [ ( 3 ) H ] - CGP 12177 radioligand binding and [ ( 3 ) H ] - cAMP accumulation were measured .
【GOLD_E】
[(3)H]-CGP12177	chem
[(3)H]-cAMP	chem
humanbeta(1),beta(2)orbeta(3)-adrenoceptor	geneN
【PRE_E】
humanbeta(1)	geneY
beta(2)	geneY
beta(3)-adrenoceptor	geneN
[(3)H]-CGP12177	chem
[(3)H]-cAMP	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

KEY RESULTS : Several agonists were found to be highly subtype selective because of selective affinity ( e.g . salmeterol and formoterol , for the beta ( 2 ) - adrenoceptor over the beta ( 1 ) or beta ( 3 ) ) , while others ( e.g . isoprenaline ) had little affinity - selectivity .
【GOLD_E】
beta(2)-adrenoceptor	geneY
beta(1)	geneY
beta(3)	geneY

isoprenaline	chem
【PRE_E】

【PRE_R】

However , the intrinsic efficacy of salmeterol , formoterol and isoprenaline was similar across all three receptor subtypes .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【PRE_R】

Other ligands ( e.g . denopamine for beta ( 1 ) ; clenbuterol , AZ 40140d , salbutamol for beta ( 2 ) ) were found to have subtype - selective intrinsic efficacy .
【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】
beta(1)-andbeta(3)-adrenoceptors	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CONCLUSIONS AND IMPLICATIONS : There are agonists with subtype selectivity based upon both selective affinity and selective intrinsic efficacy .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Therefore , there is scope to develop better selective agonists based upon both selective affinity and selective intrinsic efficacy .

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】

Rasagiline ( N - propargyl - 1 - ( R ) - aminoindan ) is a novel , highly potent irreversible monoamine oxidase ( MAO ) - B inhibitor , anti - Parkinsonian drug .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_R】

Rasagiline is effective as monotherapy or adjunct to L - Dopa for patients with early and late Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【PRE_E】

【PRE_R】
TVP1022	MAO-B	C4

However , both compounds have similar molecular mechanisms of neuroprotection in neuronal cell cultures and animal neurodegenerative models , indicating that the neuroprotective effect of rasagiline does not depend on inhibition of MAO - B , but rather is associated with the N - propargyl moiety , which promotes mitochondrial viability and stabilizes permeability transition by regulating Bcl - 2 family proteins .

Novel findings demonstrated that the major metabolite of rasagiline , 1 - ( R ) - aminoindan has antioxidant and neuroprotective capabilities and thus , may contribute to the overt activity of its parent compound , rasagiline .

Identification of neuronal target areas for nerve agents and specification of receptors for pharmacological treatment .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In order to shorten the list of candidate drugs with anticonvulsant potential against nerve agents , critical subreceptors in seizure controlling brain regions should be specified .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Epileptiform activity does not spread randomly throughout the brain , but appears to be generated and propagated by specific anatomical routes .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Nerve agents evoke seizure activity in the forebrain that progresses to the hind brain resulting in tonic - clonic convulsions .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In some recent studies , it was shown that lesion of the area tempestas ( AT ) , medial septum ( MS ) , perirhinal cortex ( PRC ) , or posterior piriform cortex ( PPC ) produces anticonvulsant effects ( prevention of convulsions or delayed onset of convulsions ) in rats exposed to soman , whereas damage to nucleus accumbens , nucleus basalis magnocellularis , amygdala , hippocampus , or entorhinal cortex does not cause anticonvulsant impact .
【GOLD_E】
soman	chem
【PRE_E】
soman	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These results are in compliance with findings that seizures can be generated in AT , MS , PRC , and PPC by means of nerve agents , chemoconvulsants , or kindling .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
chemoconvulsants	chem
kindling	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Results from microinfusion studies show that anticonvulsant efficacy is obtained by GABA ( A ) modulators or cholinergic antagonists ( M1 - M5 ) in AT , cholinergic antagonists ( M1 - M5 ) in MS , combined glutamatergic ( NMDA ) and cholinergic antagonist ( M1 - M4 ) , AMPA antagonist , or modulators of metabotropic glutamate receptors ( mGluR5 , mGluR2 / 3 ) in PRC , and cholinergic antagonist ( M1 - M5 ) or GABA ( A ) agonist in PPC .

Selective cyclooxygenase - 2 ( COX - 2 ) inhibitors and breast cancer risk .

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

BACKGROUND : Recent epidemiologic and laboratory studies have suggested that non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) may reduce the risk of breast cancer through inhibition of cyclooxygenase - 2 ( COX - 2 ) .
【GOLD_E】
cyclooxygenase-2	geneY
COX-2	geneY

【PRE_E】
steroidal	chem
cyclooxygenase-2	geneY

【GOLD_R】

【PRE_R】
steroidal	cyclooxygenase-2	C4
steroidal	COX-2	C4

METHODS : We conducted a case - control study to measure the association between selective cox - 2 inhibitors , particularly celecoxib , rofecoxib , valdecoxib and non - specific NSAID subgroups , and breast cancer risk .
【GOLD_E】
cox-2	geneY
celecoxib	chem
rofecoxib	chem
valdecoxib	chem
【PRE_E】
cox-2	geneY
celecoxib	chem
rofecoxib	chem
valdecoxib	chem
【GOLD_R】
celecoxib	cox-2	C4
rofecoxib	cox-2	C4
valdecoxib	cox-2	C4
【PRE_R】
cox-2	celecoxib	C4
cox-2	rofecoxib	C4
cox-2	valdecoxib	C4

Between 2003 and 2006 , a total of 18,368 incident breast cancer cases were identified in the Ingenix / Lab Rx insurance database , which contains clinical encounter and drug prescription data .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Four controls per case were randomly selected , matched on age and time in database .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Odds ratios ( OR ) and 95 % confidence intervals ( CI ) were estimated using conditional logistic regression .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

RESULTS : Breast cancer risk was inversely associated with both non - specific NSAID and selective COX - 2 inhibitor use .
【GOLD_E】
COX-2	geneY
【PRE_E】
COX-2	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Greater than 12 months ' duration of use of Celecoxib at a standard dose ( 200mg / day ) was associated with a 16 % decrease in breast cancer risk ( OR = 0.84 , 95 % CI = 0.73 , 0.97 ) .
【GOLD_E】
Celecoxib	chem
【PRE_E】
Celecoxib	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We observed the greatest risk reduction in association with > 2 years of rofecoxib exposure ( OR = 0.54 , 95 % CI = 0.37 , 0.80 ) .
【GOLD_E】
rofecoxib	chem
【PRE_E】
rofecoxib	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Acetaminophen , a compound with less biological plausibility for chemoprevention , showed no significant association with the risk of developing breast cancer .
【GOLD_E】
Acetaminophen	chem
【PRE_E】
Acetaminophen	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CONCLUSION : Consistent with animal models and laboratory investigations , higher doses of selective COX - 2 inhibitors were more protective against breast cancer than non - specific NSAIDs .
【GOLD_E】
COX-2	geneY
【PRE_E】
COX-2	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

With exposure to rofecoxib , a selective COX - 2 inhibitor , breast cancer risk reduction was appreciable ( 46 % ) , suggesting a possible role for selective COX - 2 inhibitors in breast cancer prophylaxis .

BACKGROUND : The effects of histamine H1 antagonist chlorcyclizine on rat palate development were characterized following in utero exposure .

METHODS : To identify the optimum dose for inducing cleft palate , pregnant rats were administered 30 , 60 , or 90 mg / kg chlorcyclizine on Gestation Days 11 to 14 .
【GOLD_E】
chlorcyclizine	chem
【PRE_E】
chlorcyclizine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Fetal palate gene expression was also assessed after 90 mg / kg chlorcyclizine at 8 , 15 and 30 hours post - dose on Gestation Day 14 using microarray and qRT - PCR .
【GOLD_E】
chlorcyclizine	chem
【PRE_E】
chlorcyclizine	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

RESULTS : Rats in the 60 - and 90 - mg / kg groups exhibited adverse clinical signs and body weight loss .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Rats in the 90 - mg / kg group also demonstrated increases in late resorptions and decreases in fetal weight .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Effects in the low - dose group were limited to decreases in body weight gain .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Fetal assessment on Gestation Day 21 revealed that findings were limited to the 60 - and 90 - mg / kg groups , and included cleft palate ( 80 % of litters for both groups ) , high arched palate , small nose , micrognathia , high domed head , digits shortened / absent and small limb .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The fetal incidence of cleft palate was higher at 90 mg / kg , thus this dose was selected to assess palate gene expression .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
palate	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The altered genes associated with chlorcyclizine - induced cleft palate included Wnt5a , Bmp2 , Bmp4 , Fgf10 , Fgfr2 , Msx1 , and Insig1 but the magnitude of the change was relatively small ( 1.5 - to 2 - fold ) .
【GOLD_E】

CONCLUSIONS : Expression of several genes involved in palate , limb and digit development was altered in the fetal palate following in utero exposure to chlorcyclizine .

chlorcyclizine	chem
【PRE_E】

GABA ( A ) receptors as molecular targets of general anesthetics : identification of binding sites provides clues to allosteric modulation .
【GOLD_E】
GABA(A)receptors	geneN
【PRE_E】
GABA(A)receptors	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

PURPOSE : The purpose of this review is to summarize current knowledge of detailed biochemical evidence for the role of gamma - aminobutyric acid type A receptors ( GABA ( A ) - Rs ) in the mechanisms of general anesthesia .
【GOLD_E】
gamma-aminobutyricacidtypeAreceptors	geneN
GABA(A)-Rs	geneN
gamma-aminobutyricacid	chem
【PRE_E】
gamma-aminobutyricacidtypeAreceptors	geneY
GABA(A)-Rs	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

PRINCIPAL FINDINGS : With the knowledge that all general anesthetics positively modulate GABA ( A ) - R - mediated inhibitory transmission , site - directed mutagenesis comparing sequences of GABA ( A ) - R subunits of varying sensitivity led to identification of amino acid residues in the transmembrane domain that are critical for the drug actions in vitro .
【GOLD_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneN
GABA(A)-R	geneN
aminoacid	chem
【PRE_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneY
GABA(A)-R	geneN
aminoacid	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Using a photo incorporable analogue of the general anesthetic , R ( + ) etomidate , we identified two transmembrane amino acids that were affinity labelled in purified bovine brain GABA ( A ) - R .
【GOLD_E】
aminoacids	chem
bovinebrainGABA(A)-R	geneN
R(+)etomidate	chem
【PRE_E】
R(+)etomidate	chem
aminoacids	chem
bovinebrainGABA(A)-R	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Homology protein structural modelling positions these two residues , alphaM1 - 11 ' and betaM3 - 4 ' , close to each other in a single type of intersubunit etomidate binding pocket at the beta / alpha interface .
【GOLD_E】
etomidate	chem
intersubunitetomidatebindingpocket	geneN
beta/alphainterface	geneN
【PRE_E】
alphaM1	chem
betaM3	chem
etomidate	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

This position would be appropriate for modulation of agonist channel gating .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Overall , available information suggests that these two etomidate binding residues are allosterically coupled to sites of action of steroids , barbiturates , volatile agents , and propofol , but not alcohols .
【GOLD_E】
etomidate	chem
steroids	chem
barbiturates	chem
propofol	chem
alcohols	chem
【PRE_E】
etomidate	chem
steroids	chem
barbiturates	chem
propofol	chem
alcohols	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Residue alpha / betaM2 - 15 ' is probably not a binding site but allosterically coupled to action of volatile agents , alcohols , and intravenous agents , and alpha / betaM1 - ( - 2 ' ) is coupled to action of intravenous agents .
【GOLD_E】
alcohols	chem
【PRE_E】
alcohols	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

CONCLUSIONS : Establishment of a coherent and consistent structural model of the GABA ( A ) - R lends support to the conclusion that general anesthetics can modulate function by binding to appropriate domains on the protein .
【GOLD_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneN
【PRE_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Genetic engineering of mice with mutation in some of these GABA ( A ) - R residues are insensitive to general anesthetics in vivo , suggesting that further analysis of these domains could lead to development of more potent and specific drugs .
【GOLD_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneN
【PRE_E】
GABA(A)-R	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Secretion induced by TRH , hyposmolarity , or high K + was optimal at pH 7.3 - 7.65 and was significantly depressed at pH 6.0 or 8.0 , indicating that release of hormone induced by all 3 stimuli is due to an active cell process requiring a physiologic extracellular pH and is not produced by nonspecific cell toxicity .

The signaling pathway of the receptor tyrosine kinase MET and its ligand hepatocyte growth factor ( HGF ) is important for cell growth , survival , and motility and is functionally linked to the signaling pathway of VEGF , which is widely recognized as a key effector in angiogenesis and cancer progression .

Thiocolchicoside suppresses osteoclastogenesis induced by RANKL and cancer cells through inhibition of inflammatory pathways : a new use for an old drug .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
Thiocolchicoside	RANKL	C4

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : Most patients with cancer die not because of the tumour in the primary site , but because it has spread to other sites .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Common tumours , such as breast , multiple myeloma , and prostate tumours , frequently metastasize to the bone .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

To search for an inhibitor of cancer - induced bone loss , we investigated the effect of thiocolchicoside , a semi - synthetic colchicoside derived from the plant Gloriosa superba and clinically used as a muscle relaxant , on osteoclastogenesis induced by receptor activator of NF - kappaB ligand ( RANKL ) and tumour cells .
【GOLD_E】

colchicoside	RANKL	C4

EXPERIMENTAL APPROACH : We used RAW 264.7 ( murine macrophage ) cells , a well - established system for osteoclastogenesis , and evaluated the effect of thiocolchicoside on RANKL - induced NF - kappaB signalling and osteoclastogenesis as well as on osteoclastogenesis induced by tumour cells .
【GOLD_E】
RANKL	geneY
NF-kappaB	geneN

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

KEY RESULTS : Thiocolchicoside suppressed osteoclastogenesis induced by RANKL , and by breast cancer and multiple myeloma cells .
【GOLD_E】
RANKL	geneY
Thiocolchicoside	chem
【PRE_E】

RANKL	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
Thiocolchicoside	RANKL	C4

Inhibition of the NF - kappaB pathway was responsible for this effect since the colchicoside inhibited RANKL - induced NF - kappaB activation , activation of IkappaB kinase ( IKK ) and suppressed inhibitor of NF - kappaBalpha ( IkappaBalpha ) phosphorylation and degradation , an inhibitor of NF - kappaB .

Cholinergic neurons of the pontine laterodorsal tegmentum ( LDT ) are importantly involved in neurobiological mechanisms governing states of arousal such as sleep and wakefulness as well as other appetitive behaviors , such as drug - seeking .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Accordingly , mechanisms controlling their excitability are important to elucidate if we are to understand how these LDT neurons generate arousal states .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
LDT	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Glutamate mediates the vast majority of excitatory synaptic transmission in the vertebrate CNS and while presence of glutamate input in the LDT has been shown and ionotropic responses to glutamate have been reported in the LDT , characterization of metabotropic responses is lacking .

A potent Chk1 inhibitor is selectively cytotoxic in melanomas with high levels of replicative stress .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

There are few effective treatments for metastatic melanoma .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Checkpoint kinase 1 ( Chk1 ) inhibitors are being trialled for their efficacy in enhancing conventional chemotherapeutic agents , but their effectiveness as single agents is not known .
【GOLD_E】
Checkpointkinase1	geneY
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】

Chk1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We have examined the effectiveness of two novel Chk1 selective inhibitors , AR323 and AR678 , in a panel of melanoma cell lines and normal cell types .
【GOLD_E】
AR323	chem
AR678	chem
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneN

【GOLD_R】
AR323	Chk1	C4
AR678	Chk1	C4
【PRE_R】

We demonstrate that these drugs display single - agent activity , with IC50s in the low nanomolar range .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The drugs produce cytotoxic effects in cell lines that are most sensitive to these drugs , whereas normal cells are only sensitive to these drugs at the higher concentrations where they have cytostatic activity .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The cytotoxic effect is the consequence of inhibition of S - phase Chk1 , which drives cells prematurely from late S phase into an aberrant mitosis and results in either failure of cytokinesis or cell death through an apoptotic mechanism .
【GOLD_E】
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The sensitivity to the Chk1 inhibitors was correlated with the level of endogenous DNA damage indicating replicative stress .
【GOLD_E】
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Chk1 inhibitors are viable single - agent therapies that target melanoma cells with high levels of endogenous DNA damage .
【GOLD_E】
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

This sensitivity suggests that Chk1 is a critical component of an adaptation to replicative stress in these cells .
【GOLD_E】
Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Chk1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

It also suggests that markers of DNA damage may be useful in identifying the melanomas and potentially other tumour types that are more likely to be sensitive to Chk1 inhibitors as single agents .

Chk1	geneY
【PRE_E】

The Warburg effect in cancer cells has been proposed to involve several mechanisms , including adaptation to hypoxia , oncogenes activation or loss of oncosuppressors and impaired mitochondrial function .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
oncosuppressors	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In previous papers , it has been shown that K - ras transformed mouse cells are much more sensitive as compared with normal cells to glucose withdrawal ( undergoing apoptosis ) and present a high glycolytic rate and a strong reduction of mitochondrial complex I .
【GOLD_E】

mitochondrialcomplexI	geneN

【PRE_R】

Recent observations suggest that transformed cells have a derangement in the cyclic adenosine monophosphate / cAMP - dependent protein kinase ( cAMP / PKA ) pathway , which is known to regulate several mitochondrial functions .
【GOLD_E】

Exogenous stimulation of PKA activity , achieved by forskolin treatment , protected K - ras - transformed cells from apoptosis induced by glucose deprivation , enhanced complex I activity , intracellular adenosine triphosphate ( ATP ) levels , mitochondrial fusion and decreased intracellular reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) levels .

【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These findings support the notion that glucose shortage - induced apoptosis , specific of K - ras - transformed cells , is associated to a derangement of PKA signaling that leads to mitochondrial complex I decrease , reduction of ATP formation , prevalence of mitochondrial fission over fusion , and thereby opening new approaches for development of anticancer drugs .

Dendritic cell migration assay : a potential prediction model for identification of contact allergens .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

This manuscript describes methodology and a prediction model for the MUTZ - LC migration assay .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The assay represents the physiological change in Langerhans cell ( LC ) behavior after exposure to a sensitizing chemical , resulting in LC migration from the epidermis to the dermis .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

MUTZ - LC are derived from the commercially available MUTZ - 3 cell line .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
MUTZ-LC	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Upon exposure to a sensitizer MUTZ - LC migrate preferentially towards CXCL12 whereas upon exposure to a non - sensitizer MUTZ - LC migrate towards CCL5 .
【GOLD_E】

CCL5	geneY
【PRE_E】
MUTZ-LC	chem
CXCL12	geneY

CCL5	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】
MUTZ-LC	CXCL12	C3
CXCL12	MUTZ-LC	C3
MUTZ-LC	CCL5	C3

A CXCL12 / CCL5 ratio > 1.10 in 2 / 3 independent experiments is indicative of a sensitizer , whereas a CXCL12 / CCL5 ratio ≤ 1.10 is indicative of a non - sensitizer .
【GOLD_E】

Lipid biomarkers of oxidative stress in a genetic mouse model of Smith - Lemli - Opitz syndrome .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

7 - Dehydrocholesterol ( 7 - DHC ) accumulates in tissues and fluids of patients with Smith - Lemli - Opitz syndrome ( SLOS ) , which is caused by mutations in the gene encoding 3β - hydroxysterol - Δ ( 7 ) - reductase ( DHCR7 ) .

We recently reported that 7 - DHC is the most reactive lipid molecule toward free radical oxidation ( lipid peroxidation ) and 14 oxysterols have been identified as products of oxidation of 7 - DHC in solution .
【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

As the high oxidizability of 7 - DHC may lead to systemic oxidative stress in SLOS patients , we report here lipid biomarkers of oxidative stress in a Dhcr7 - KO mouse model of SLOS , including oxysterols , isoprostanes ( IsoPs ) , and neuroprostanes ( NeuroPs ) that are formed from the oxidation of 7 - DHC , arachidonic acid and docosahexaenoic acid , respectively .

Ageing is associated with a deterioration of cognitive performance and with increased risk of neurodegenerative disorders .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Hypertension is the most - prevalent modifiable risk factor for cardiovascular morbidity and mortality worldwide , and clinical data suggest that hypertension is a risk factor for Alzheimer 's disease ( AD ) .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Leydig cell hyperplasia and Leydig cell tumours of the ovary are rare .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We present two cases in which patients had increased blood levels of testosterone and frank hirsutism .
【GOLD_E】
testosterone	chem
【PRE_E】
testosterone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Imaging showed minimal abnormalities .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

After adrenal disease had been ruled out , they underwent a bilateral oophorectomy .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

One case showed a Leydig cell hyperplasia , the other a Leydig cell tumour .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

An androgen producing tumour should be excluded in every woman with evidence of hirsutism or frank virilization and markedly elevated testosterone levels .
【GOLD_E】
androgen	chem
testosterone	chem
【PRE_E】
androgen	chem
testosterone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Adrenal disease with androgen hypersecretion can be suspected by detailed clinical , laboratory and radiologic imaging .
【GOLD_E】
androgen	chem
【PRE_E】
androgen	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Although DHEAS has a good sensitivity in the detection of adrenal origin of hyperandrogenism ( and hence a good negative predictive value ) it is not specific ( specificity ranging from 85 to 98 % ) .
【GOLD_E】
DHEAS	chem
【PRE_E】
DHEAS	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Imaging of the ovaries can be helpful but does not rule out ovarian disease if normal .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Indeed , diffuse stromal Leydig cell hyperplasia and Leydig cell tumours ( usually small ) may escape imaging and in some cases diagnosis can only be made on pathology .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

As these clinical entities represent a diagnostic and therapeutic challenge , oophorectomy should be considered in postmenopausal women with hirsutism and elevated testosterone levels , after the exclusion of adrenal causes .
【GOLD_E】
testosterone	chem
【PRE_E】
testosterone	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The procedure is relatively safe and effective .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Follow - up remains indicated .

【GOLD_E】

【GOLD_R】

In this study we analyzed some aspects of the assessment of developmental delay in the zebrafish embryotoxicity / teratogenicity test and explored the suitability of acetylcholinesterase ( AChE ) activity as a biochemical marker and as a higher throughput alternative to morphological endpoints such as head - trunk angle , tail length and morphological score .

An overview of transcriptional regulation in response to toxicological insult .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The completion of the human genome project and the subsequent advent of DNA microarray and high - throughput sequencing technologies have led to a renaissance in molecular toxicology .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Toxicogenomic data sets , from both in vivo and in vitro studies , are growing exponentially , providing a wealth of information on regulation of stress pathways at the transcriptome level .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Through such studies , we are now beginning to appreciate the diversity and complexity of biological responses to xenobiotics .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In this review , we aim to consolidate and summarise the major toxicologically relevant transcription factor - governed molecular pathways .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
toxicologically	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

It is becoming clear that different chemical entities can cause oxidative , genotoxic and proteotoxic stress , which induce cellular responses in an effort to restore homoeostasis .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Primary among the response pathways involved are NFE2L2 ( Nrf2 ) , NFE2L1 ( Nrf1 ) , p53 , heat shock factor and the unfolded protein response .
【GOLD_E】
Nrf2	geneY
NFE2L1	geneY
Nrf1	geneY
p53	geneY
heatshockfactor	geneN
NFE2L2	geneY
【PRE_E】
NFE2L2	geneY
Nrf2	geneY
NFE2L1	geneY
Nrf1	geneY
p53	geneY
heatshockfactor	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Additionally , more specific mechanisms exist where xenobiotics act as ligands , including the aryl hydrocarbon receptor , metal - responsive transcription factor - 1 and the nuclear receptor family of transcription factors .
【GOLD_E】
arylhydrocarbon	chem
arylhydrocarbonreceptor	geneY
metal-responsivetranscriptionfactor-1	geneY
nuclearreceptor	geneN
【PRE_E】
arylhydrocarbonreceptor	geneY
metal-responsivetranscriptionfactor-1	geneY
nuclearreceptor	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Other pathways including the immunomodulatory transcription factors NF - κB and STAT together with the hypoxia - inducible transcription factor HIF are also implicated in cellular responses to xenobiotic exposure .
【GOLD_E】
NF-κB	geneN
STAT	geneN
hypoxia-inducibletranscriptionfactor	geneN
HIF	geneN
【PRE_E】
NF-κB	geneN
STAT	geneN
hypoxia-inducibletranscriptionfactorHIF	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

A less specific but equally important aspect to cellular injury controlled by transcriptional activity is loss of tissue - specific gene expression , resulting in dedifferentiation of target cells and compromise of tissue function .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Here , we review these pathways and the genes they regulate in order to provide an overview of this growing field of molecular toxicology .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Apparently , a small diameter nanotube surface has on average more sharp convex edges per unit area than a large one , leading to stronger binding affinity on its surface .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】

【PRE_R】

Abnormal uterine bleeding and dysfunctional uterine bleeding in pediatric and adolescent gynecology .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Abnormal uterine bleeding ( AUB ) , which is defined as excessively heavy , prolonged and / or frequent bleeding of uterine origin , is a frequent cause of visits to the Emergency Department and / or health care provider .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

While there are many etiologies of AUB , the one most likely among otherwise healthy adolescents is dysfunctional uterine bleeding ( DUB ) , which is characterizing any AUB when all possible underlying pathologic causes have been previously excluded .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
AUB	geneN
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The most common cause of DUB in adolescence is anovulation , which is very frequent in the first 2 - 3 post - menarchal years and is associated with immaturity of the hypothalamic - pituitary - ovarian axis .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
DUB	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Management of AUB is based on the underlying etiology and the severity of the bleeding and primary goals are prevention of complications , such as anemia and reestablishment of regular cyclical bleeding , while the management of DUB can in part be directed by the amount of flow , the degree of associated anemia , as well as patient and family comfort with different treatment modalities .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
AUB	geneY
DUB	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Treatment options for DUB are : combined oral contraceptives ( COCs ) , progestogens , non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) , tranexamic acid ( anti - fibrinolytic ) , GnRH analogues , Danazol and Levonorgestrel releasing intra uterine system ( LNG IUS ) .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

Intramuscular ( i.m . ) huBuChE afforded almost complete protection when administered prior to the onset of observable cholinergic signs of VX poisoning , but once signs of poisoning became evident the efficacy of i.m . huBuChE decreased .

A combination of nerve agent therapy drugs ( oxime , anti - muscarinic , anticonvulsant ) with huBuChE ( i.m . ) protected 100 % ( 8 / 8 ) of guinea - pigs from a lethal dose of VX ( 0.74mg / kg ) to 48h , even when administered on signs of poisoning .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】

【PRE_E】

【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

We genotyped 48 schizophrenia patients who completed 50 h of computerized cognitive training and analyzed the association between DNA variants in the COMT gene and the improvement in global cognition .
【GOLD_E】
COMT	geneY
【PRE_E】
COMT	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Although conventional analyses did not reveal any significant associations , a set - based analysis examining the aggregate effect of common variation in the COMT gene ( 42 SNPs ) suggested association with improvement in global cognition .
【GOLD_E】
COMT	geneY
【PRE_E】
COMT	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Eight SNPs , mostly located in the 3 ' end of the COMT gene , were nominally associated with improvement in cognition .
【GOLD_E】
COMT	geneY
【PRE_E】
COMT	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These data suggest that genotype influences the response to intensive cognitive training in schizophrenia , and may indicate that cognitive training regimens need to be personalized to the underlying biosignatures of each individual patient .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The influence of chronic fluorosis on mitochondrial dynamics morphology and distribution in cortical neurons of the rat brain .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The present study was designed to evaluate the effects of chronic fluorosis on the dynamics ( including fusion and fission proteins ) , fragmentation , and distribution of mitochondria in the cortical neurons of the rat brain in an attempt to elucidate molecular mechanisms underlying the brain damage associated with excess accumulation of fluoride .
【GOLD_E】
fluoride	chem
【PRE_E】
fluoride	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Sixty Sprague - Dawley rats were divided randomly into three groups of 20 each , that is , the untreated control group ( drinking water naturally containing < 0.5 mg fluoride / l , NaF ) , the low - fluoride group ( whose drinking water was supplemented with 10 mg fluoride / l ) and the high - fluoride group ( 50 mg fluoride / l ) .
【GOLD_E】
luoride/	chem
aF)	chem
luorideg	chem
uoride/l	chem
uoridegr	chem
oride/l)	chem
【PRE_E】
fluoride	chem
NaF	chem
fluoride	chem
fluoride	chem
fluoride	chem
fluoride	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

After 6 months of exposure , the expression of mitofusin - 1 ( Mfn1 ) , fission - 1 ( Fis1 ) , and dynamin - related protein - 1 ( Drp1 ) at both the protein and mRNA levels were detected by Western blotting , immunohistochemistry , and real - time PCR , respectively .
【GOLD_E】
itofusin-1(	geneY
fn1)	geneY
ission-1(	geneY
is1)	geneY
ynamin-relatedprotein-1(	geneY
rp1)	geneY

fission-1	geneY

dynamin-relatedprotein-1	geneY
Drp1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Moreover , mitochondrial morphology and distribution in neurons were observed by transmission electron or fluorescence microscopy .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

In the cortices of the brains of rats with chronic fluorosis , the level of Mfn1 protein was clearly reduced , whereas the levels of Fis1 and Drp1 were elevated .
【GOLD_E】
Drp1	geneY
Mfn1	geneY
Fis1	geneY
【PRE_E】
Mfn1	geneY
Fis1	geneY
Drp1	geneY
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The alternations of expression of the mRNAs encoding all three of these proteins were almost the same as the corresponding changes at the protein levels .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

The mitochondria were fragmented and the redistributed away from the axons of the cortical neurons .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

These findings indicate that chronic fluorosis induces abnormal mitochondrial dynamics , which might in turn result in a high level of oxidative stress .
【GOLD_E】
【PRE_E】

【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】
graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Owing to their unique physical and chemical properties , graphene and its derivatives such as graphene oxide ( GO ) , reduced graphene oxide ( RGO ) and GO - nanocomposites have attracted tremendous interest in many different fields including biomedicine in recent years .
【GOLD_E】

【PRE_E】
graphene	chem

grapheneoxide	chem
RGO	chem
GO	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

With every atom exposed on its surface , single - layered graphene shows ultra - high surface area available for efficient molecular loading and bioconjugation , and has been widely explored as novel nano - carriers for drug and gene delivery .
【GOLD_E】
graphene	chem
【PRE_E】
graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Utilizing the intrinsic near - infrared ( NIR ) optical absorbance , in vivo graphene - based photothermal therapy has been realized , achieving excellent anti - tumor therapeutic efficacy in animal experiments .
【GOLD_E】
graphene	chem
【PRE_E】
graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

A variety of inorganic nanoparticles can be grown on the surface of nano - graphene , obtaining functional graphene - based nanocomposites with interesting optical and magnetic properties useful for multi - modal imaging and imaging - guided cancer therapy .
【GOLD_E】
graphene	chem
graphene	chem
【PRE_E】
graphene	chem
graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Moreover , significant efforts have also been devoted to study the behaviors and toxicology of functionalized nano - graphene in animals .
【GOLD_E】
graphene	chem
【PRE_E】
nano-graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

It has been uncovered that both surface chemistry and sizes play key roles in controlling the biodistribution , excretion , and toxicity of nano - graphene .
【GOLD_E】
graphene	chem
【PRE_E】
graphene	chem
【GOLD_R】
【PRE_R】

Biocompatibly coated nano - graphene with ultra - small sizes can be cleared out from body after systemic administration , without rendering noticeable toxicity to the treated mice .
